page.title: 10CHEVELEY BUILDINGS & CHURCH
page.content: In Cheveley, there are 55 buildings along the main street from the church towards Saxon Street. We estimated that 37 are old, 9 are new and 9 are in between. The roof materials on the buildings are a mixture of thatch, tiles, pantiles, slates and asbestos. Many of the buildings are listed buildings. Mrs Cazenave, the clerk of Cheveley Parish Council, told us about them: they are buildings that can't be knocked down without permission. If one of the windows falls out, it has to be relaced with the same materials and design. We visited St Mary's Church Cheveley. It has stained glass windows and white walls. 40 people have signed the visitors' book in 1985: most have come from Newmarket(9) and 2 have come from abroard. There are 202 graves occupied and 12 people have been buried in 1985
